text:
The attached fo always gives me an NPE with -rtf only, not with -pdf, -txt and
-png (these are the ones I've tested). Reproducable with trunk + 0.90, the fo
validates with all known resources listed in the FAQ. 


Normal (without -d) 
================================================================================
C:\fop-0.90alpha1>fop EVMT_Auflistung_Evmt.fo_transform.xml -png test.png
rendering areas to PNG
Warning(12/21): fo:table, The collapsing border model on an fo:table is currentl
y not supported by FOP
Warning(12/21): fo:table, table-layout="auto" is currently not supported by FOP
Warning(27/31): fo:table, The collapsing border model on an fo:table is currentl
y not supported by FOP
Warning(27/31): fo:table, table-layout="auto" is currently not supported by FOP
TODO Add collapsed border painting for spanned cells
Rendering Page 1 (pageWidth 595, pageHeight 792)
C:\fop-0.90alpha1>fop EVMT_Auflistung_Evmt.fo_transform.xml -rtf test.rtf
Warning(12/21): fo:table, The collapsing border model on an fo:table is currentl
y not supported by FOP
Warning(12/21): fo:table, table-layout="auto" is currently not supported by FOP
Warning(27/31): fo:table, The collapsing border model on an fo:table is currentl
y not supported by FOP
Warning(27/31): fo:table, table-layout="auto" is currently not supported by FOP
Exception
java.lang.NullPointerException
================================================================================




with -d:
================================================================================
C:\fop-0.90alpha1>fop -d EVMT_Auflistung_Evmt.fo_transform.xml -rtf test.rtf
Building formatting object tree
Warning(12/21): fo:table, The collapsing border model on an fo:table is currentl
y not supported by FOP
Warning(12/21): fo:table, table-layout="auto" is currently not supported by FOP
Warning(27/31): fo:table, The collapsing border model on an fo:table is currentl
y not supported by FOP
Warning(27/31): fo:table, table-layout="auto" is currently not supported by FOP
starting flow: xsl-region-body
endElement for top-level fo:root
Parsing of document complete

creator: michael.linux@web.de

text:
Created attachment 17093
the offending FO

The offending tags/attributes/values are commented. Hope this testcase helps.
creator: michael.linux@web.de

text:
Please note that there are two calls to fop in the normal listing: one with
-png, one with -rtf. I forgot to split them up, sorry about that.
creator: michael.linux@web.de

text:
It looks like the problem is a legacy from JFOR which was integrated into FOP.
See here:
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/xmlgraphics-fop-dev/200508.mbox/%3cPine.LNX.4.63.0508131545101.3490@student.dei.uc.pt%3e

Unfortunately, RTF has to line up further back in my queue at the moment, so I
don't have time to look more closely at the problem. Maybe one of the other RTF
specialists has time to have a look. In the meantime, please try to avoid nested
tables when using the RTF output.
creator: jeremias@apache.org
pherweg@web.de
text:
I am working on it. The offending FO file does not throw a NPE anymore. But the 
result still does not look like expected. 

Kind regards,
Peter Herweg

creator: pherweg@web.de
text:
Bug is fixed.

After fixing the NPE, i noticed a second bug: number-columns-spanned did not 
work in last row of a table. This is fixed now.

Thank you for reporting!

Kind regards,
Peter Herweg

creator: michael.linux@web.de
text:
Thank you.  
Yes, the number-columns-spanned thing would have been my next bug to report.  
You were faster :-)

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
